title: PSA: ITS OK TO TELL PEOPLE WHAT THEY ARE BEING BAD AT
body: Or at least it should be with out getting a penalty or risk a report to even a stfu dont tell me how to play. This argument is not saying it's ok to tell people THEY are bad. Just bringing up what problems they are facing by what actions they are doing. MIGHT want to stop building full dmg items 8 deaths into this 15 minute game... Nope reported

replies.body:
Instead of telling them what they are doing wrong, tell them how to do it right.  

You're terrible, learn to CS.  That's not constructive.  

Try to get the last hit on all your minions.  That is constructive.

Did you read my post? That is the same thing as just telling somebody they are bad. I word it in the way to stop trying to shove the lane we have no idea where the jungler is and im out of wards. No reason to burn mana trying to shove the lane when you could use that mana for your escape or self cc

> Try to get the last hit on all your minions.  That is constructive.

Not really, that's just being condescending. There's no reason to expect they are not already trying to do that, it's just shoving at their face that they are failing at it. It's no different than telling someone to stop feeding.

> [{quoted}](name=Inuyasha99999,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=uHAMEbER,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-03-06T03:46:59.266+0000)
>
>  Just bringing up what problems they are facing by what actions they are doing. MIGHT want to stop building full dmg items 8 deaths into this 15 minute game

Just doing this is perfectly within the rules. Now if you are calling them bad and insulting them while doing it, then its not gonna go so well for you.
Within the rules or not if you get enough reports by people who get triggered by it then riot steps in and wiggles their finger

I mean I've been playing league since season 2 and I offer my two cents when I see a teammate struggling. Sometimes they are appreciative and other times not so much. I've never received any form of punishment throughout all this time, so I don't think Riot is gonna issue you anything unless you're doing it wrong.

PSA: if you use all caps on your title people are going to downvote it because they think it is a rage post.


also reports that get a chatlog like this

deathgod5: you should build a moral reminder instead of crit
deathgod5: as a nautilus I don't your build has to include a phantom dancer.
deathgod5: please build more defensive shyv.

don't end in you being punished.
More likely than not you're going to go about it in a toxic/grievous manner. So no. Best to not tell people how to play.
Has anybody taken a psyche class? People dont learn by rewarding failures. You reward for them doing well and if they arent then no reward. Thats just human nature

Kids on league of legends don't learn, at all. Everyone in the game thinks they know better than anyone else how to play, what to build, etc. At least, a large majority of kids do. Every time I log on to play around 3-5pm EST time, there's a boatload of ego-centric trash talking toxic griefing know-it-all 15 year olds playing. Scary stuff. It's amusing though post-game when I consistently get the pop-up message saying someone I reported was punished. That's how you teach these kids. Removing their account, so they know they gone fucked up.

> [{quoted}](name=SwainLaneWinGame,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=uHAMEbER,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-03-06T04:37:16.941+0000)
>
> Kids on league of legends don't learn, at all. Everyone in the game thinks they know better than anyone else how to play, what to build, etc. 

This.  While I hate generalizing, I've been playing for 3 years now fairly consistently and 85% of all of my games have at least 1-2 people that just act like complete jerks for no reason.  When I say no reason, I consider this to be acting like a jerk when everyone on the team has messed up multiple times including themselves, and is clearly losing as a team, yet these people find the one mistake someone else made and blames the loss on them, repeatedly telling the other team to report, and using all chat at all times to ridicule that person.  

Yes, all of this, in about 85% of my games over a 3 year period.  Now granted I'm going off of how people act on the LAN server too, which is where I play ranked since my ping is much better there, but I do play more consistently in normals on NA.

This, I think, is becoming a very, very large problem in the gaming community as a whole.  Most adults either just ignore people in the beginning of the game or brush things off if someone says something, and so it does not affect them as much.  However, I can see this type of behavior being downright traumatizing to 15-16 year old kids who are already struggling to have a good social life outside of league and the last thing they need is for some little prick to be calling them autistic or telling them to uninstall.

These players are being ridiculed basically because someone else can't admit their own mistakes and wants to throw someone else under the bus in front of 8 other people.  That goes back to another societal issue where people think they can do no wrong now and don't take responsibility for their own actions.

So when someone says it's okay for you to tell people when they are making a mistake, I just shake my head because I know that what the OP means is not what 85% of the gaming community is actually going to do.

It's not your job to teach people, and at any rate they're not gonna learn anything through a few rushed remarks by some random stranger that might as well be the most clueless player ever as far as they know. Just type less and play more, focus on what you're doing instead of trying to be the team's homeroom lecturer.

By not offering advice then that is a waste of resources if they decide to listen or not. The it's not your job mentality is really selfish and protective to the people who are throwing the games when they aren't building or playing correctly. It is EVERYBODY'S job to put on feedback to help the team grow as a whole.

Or you could just suggest to them an improvement on their current playstyle, without outright stating that they are bad? I mean that's what professional coaches do (NEACE, ls9 less so but still avoids being a douche).

And who asked you to be someones personal coach?

No one. So keep your opinions to yourself.
Im not saying be their personal coach. Im trying to optimize the team so I get my win. 500 plus armor doesnt do shit when you only have 1500 hp.

>Im trying to optimize the team

And how has that been working out for you?

[Not too well](http://www.lolking.net/summoner/na/39020317/Inuyasha99999) it would appear :-)

You're telling people that it's ok to be blunt,honest and critical... In a forum filled with sjws... Good luck getting anytthing but downvotes. Unless you're telling people they're doing amazing no matter what, you're toxic in their eyes

This is what I hate about the community. You CANT help people without somebody getting offended. Like the other day I saw a post about a sjw getting offended at an old man for holding a door open for her thinking or implied she was too weak to do it herself. I miss the old internet
